recommended_movies: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
Back to the Future Part II (1989)
Friday the 13th Part V: A New Beginning (1985)

Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (1992)

simulated_ratings.title: Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, goofy Carrey hits enough dumb laughs for me, even if it’s juvenile.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 5: Assignment: Miami Beach (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sun-drenched setting can’t hide the worn-out jokes.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 3: Back in Training (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The competition angle adds a spark, but it’s still pretty flimsy.

simulated_ratings.title: Weekend at Bernie's (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dark, silly premise delivers some laughs but also drags.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 2: Their First Assignment (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A few decent cop gags, but it’s already recycling itself.

simulated_ratings.title: Dinner for Schmucks (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mean-spirited cringe comedy lands a few bits but mostly misses for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy (1984)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raunchy, dumb fun that scratches the cop-comedy itch, if uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: Lethal Weapon 4 (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Buddy-cop banter is fine and the action is okay, but it’s fairly disposable.

simulated_ratings.title: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The western angle is cute but less fun than the wilder time-hops.

simulated_ratings.title: Dracula: Dead and Loving It (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Spoofy horror is too corny for my taste, with only occasional chuckles.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Franchise fatigue—same gags, fewer laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Back to the Future Part II (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Time-twist hijinks are entertaining enough even if a bit messy.

simulated_ratings.title: Me, Myself & Irene (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Crude, split-persona Carrey chaos hits my dumb-comedy sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Very Bad Things (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mean, dark spiral keeps me engaged, though not all the humor lands.

simulated_ratings.title: Police Academy 4: Citizens on Patrol (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The volunteers gimmick is thin

simulated_ratings.title: Land of the Lost (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy sci-fi shtick feels flat despite a few Ferrell bits.

simulated_ratings.title: Adventures of Ford Fairlane, The (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loud, sleazy detective shtick is hit-and-miss but occasionally fun.

simulated_ratings.title: Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Fish-out-of-water gags feel tired and family-safe bland.

simulated_ratings.title: Friday the 13th Part V: A New Beginning (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleazy slasher vibe and kills scratch the horror itch despite the silliness.

simulated_ratings.title: Lost Highway (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dream-logic, arty thriller isn’t my thing—too opaque for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Loaded Weapon 1 (National Lampoon's Loaded Weapon 1) (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Spoof gags are uneven but I still found some dumb laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Hills Have Eyes, The (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brutal, nasty survival horror—grim and right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Jackass: The Movie (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Crude, painful stunts make me laugh more than I should.

simulated_ratings.title: Hills Have Eyes II, The (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cheaper and dumber but still delivers enough gnarly mutant mayhem.

simulated_ratings.title: Spy Hard (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Zany spoof overload with more groans than laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Major League: Back to the Minors (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Harmless but forgettable sports-comedy rehash.

simulated_ratings.title: Hot Shots! Part Deux (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Go-for-broke spoofing gets some solid laughs, even if scattershot.

simulated_ratings.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Fun traps and holiday vibes, but it’s basically a bigger retread.

recommended_movies: Louis C.K.: Live at The Comedy Store (2015)

simulated_ratings.title: La La Land (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy romance and musical numbers leave me cold despite the showmanship.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Hilarious (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blunt, filthy observations hit my crude-funny sweet spot with plenty of big laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Chewed Up (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Vulgar, fearless bits land more often than not—raw and pretty funny.

simulated_ratings.title: Bridges of Madison County, The (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slow-burn adult romance isn’t my bag—well-acted but pretty dull for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Closer (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Nasty relationship games kept me watching, but it’s mostly sour talky drama I don’t enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Live at The Comedy Store (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Club-set looseness works—solid hour with plenty of filthy laughs, if uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: 8 Women (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The locked-room whodunit angle intrigues, but the arch, talky vibe would likely wear on me.

simulated_ratings.title: After the Screaming Stops (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Candid band drama is mildly interesting, but I’m not invested in this music scene.

simulated_ratings.title: Dan in Real Life (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet but syrupy family/romance mix—some chuckles, mostly meh.

simulated_ratings.title: Bridget Jones's Baby (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light, cutesy shenanigans wear thin

simulated_ratings.title: Sausage Party (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Filthy food gags and wrongness made me laugh more than I should, even when it goes dumb.

simulated_ratings.title: Music and Lyrics (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cute premise, but the soft romance/comedy doesn’t do much for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Spanglish (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Culture-clash dramedy is earnest but slow and way too tame for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Eyes Wide Shut (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy, cryptic sex-thriller feels pretentious and sluggish—I bounced off it.

simulated_ratings.title: Wonder Woman 1984 (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy, overlong superhero stuff with a few fun bits but mostly bloated.

simulated_ratings.title: She-Devil (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad revenge comedy is more shrill than funny for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Death Becomes Her (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Macabre slapstick and effects are fun enough, even if the tone is pretty silly.

simulated_ratings.title: What Men Want (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: High-concept gender-swap shtick feels tired with few real laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Natural Born Killers (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Frenetic, nasty violence and media satire hits at times, but the style overload wears me out.

simulated_ratings.title: The Head Hunter (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grim, low-budget monster revenge vibe scratches the horror itch despite the minimalism.

simulated_ratings.title: Love Actually (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sappy, tangled holiday romances are not my thing—too cutesy and long.

simulated_ratings.title: Bridget Jones's Diary (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Charming enough lead, but the rom-com fluff leaves me pretty indifferent.

simulated_ratings.title: I Heart Huckabees (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky, existential navel-gazing humor grates on me fast.

simulated_ratings.title: Last Summer in the Hamptons (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stagey, self-involved theater-people dramedy is a slog for me.

simulated_ratings.title: You've Got Mail (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cozy email romance is pleasant wallpaper but not my flavor.

simulated_ratings.title: Time Code (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gimmick-heavy split-screen experiment sounds like a headache—zero interest.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Shameless (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brutally honest, filthy hour that lines up with my crude sense of humor.

simulated_ratings.title: Unfriended (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever screen-chat setup and mean streak deliver enough spooky kills to satisfy me.

simulated_ratings.title: Richard Pryor: Icon (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Interesting look at a legend, but I prefer raw stand-up over talking-head tributes.

simulated_ratings.title: Lucy (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick, dumb sci-fi action with a few cool beats—fine but forgettable.

What the #$*! Do We Know!? (a.k.a. What the Bleep Do We Know!?) (2004)
Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999)
Girl with the Red Scarf, The (Selvi boylum, al yazmalim) (1978)

Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones (2002)
Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers (Halloween 6: The Curse of Michael Myers) (1995)

simulated_ratings.title: Boyhood (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Long, low-key coming-of-age isn’t my thing—well-made but pretty dull for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Serbian Film, A (Srpski film) (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Vile, shocking extreme horror that repulsed me but also scratched my nasty-horror itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Pagemaster, The (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tame, bookish fantasy adventure is cute but bland and not my flavor.

simulated_ratings.title: NeverEnding Story III, The (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Thin, kiddie-fantasy sequel with cheesy gags—mostly a slog for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Big, goofy space opera has a few fun beats but feels bloated and messy.

simulated_ratings.title: What the #$*! Do We Know!? (a.k.a. What the Bleep Do We Know!?) (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pseudo-philosophical, new-agey lecture that strikes me as pretentious and tedious.

simulated_ratings.title: Tusk (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Weird body-horror premise intrigues me, but the quirky talky humor wears thin fast.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Flashy set-pieces aside, it’s clunky and dull with lots of dead air.

simulated_ratings.title: Beloved (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Heavy, slow-burn supernatural drama I respect more than enjoy—too ponderous for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Inside The X-files (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Behind-the-scenes tidbits are mildly interesting, but I’d rather watch the creepy episodes.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darker tone and big battles help, though it’s still overlong and uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stiff romance and CG overload make it a slog with only a few decent set-pieces.

simulated_ratings.title: English Patient, The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Prestige, sweeping romance leaves me cold—handsome but painfully slow.

simulated_ratings.title: Bombshell (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Timely and well-acted, but the slick treatment feels safe and not very engaging to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gnarly, nightmarish gore and hellish imagery hit my horror sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Crow: City of Angels, The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, grim sequel with some style, but it’s pretty disposable.

simulated_ratings.title: Becks (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Serviceable portrait that kept me mildly interested, but I’m not invested in the subject.

simulated_ratings.title: Meet the Feebles (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Filthy puppet chaos gives me plenty of wrong laughs, even if it’s uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers (Halloween 6: The Curse of Michael Myers) (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The cult nonsense is goofy, but the slasher kills get the job done.

simulated_ratings.title: Choices (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest after-school-special vibes—bland and not my thing.

simulated_ratings.title: Mobile Suit Gundam F91 (1991)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick mecha battles are fine, but the lore-heavy anime leaves me indifferent.

simulated_ratings.title: Jane Eyre (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stately, well-made period romance that plays dull for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Crash: The Mystery of Flight 1501 (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A decent hook sinks into TV-movie melodrama that never really grabs me.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic space-adventure set-pieces keep me entertained even if it’s a bit silly.

simulated_ratings.title: We're Back! A Dinosaur's Story (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cute kid chaos with dinos, but it’s saccharine and forgettable for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Impressive world-building and scale, though the journey feels long and talky.

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, The (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bigger battles and creatures are fun, but it’s still a hefty sit for me.

Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End (2007)
Enchanted World of Danny Kaye: The Emperor's New Clothes, The (1972)
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004)
Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides (2011)
Jack and the Cuckoo-Clock Heart (Jack et la mécanique du coeur) (2013)
Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (2009)
Where Were You When the Lights Went Out? (1968)
Dave Chappelle: Deep in the Heart of Texas (2017)
South Park: Post Covid: The Return of Covid (2021)
Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (2002)

simulated_ratings.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Fun creature bits and swashbuckling, but it’s bloated and too goofy for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bigger and longer doesn’t equal better—draggy pirate bombast with a few decent set-pieces.

simulated_ratings.title: The Gentlemen (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick crime caper with cheeky banter

simulated_ratings.title: Cabin in the Woods, The (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever meta setup, creature mayhem, and a mean streak—my kind of horror twist.

simulated_ratings.title: Bo Burnham: Inside (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever and well-made, but the introspective musical comedy leaves me cold after a while.

simulated_ratings.title: Idle Hands (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dumb stoner gags plus splattery demon-hand chaos hit my trashy horror-comedy itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Disturbing the Peace (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest, heavy doc with a worthy message, but it plays preachy and not my thing.

simulated_ratings.title: Grindhouse (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy, gory exploitation fun—Planet Terror kills, Death Proof drags but the package works.

simulated_ratings.title: Jeepers Creepers 2 (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dopey dialogue, solid creature-stalk setup, and enough kills to scratch the itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Tropic Thunder (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rowdy, wrong-headed Hollywood skewering with plenty of big, crude laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Pink Panther, The (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad slapstick and silly mystery—mostly harmless, mostly not funny for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Planet Terror (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gooey, over-the-top zombie mayhem with grindhouse attitude—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darker tone and creatures help, though it’s still a long, talky fantasy ride for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Series fatigue—lighter on fun, heavier on bloat

simulated_ratings.title: Solo (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Abstract short-film vibes aren’t my thing—feels like artsy homework.

simulated_ratings.title: The Ravenous (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak family spiral with hints of horror, but as straight drama it’s too ponderous for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Mouse Hunt (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cartoony slapstick and cutesy tone—fine for kids, pretty thin for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Your Highness (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Juvenile fantasy quest with a few crude laughs, mostly limp.

simulated_ratings.title: Final Destination 2 (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gnarly chain-reaction kills and mean spirit—exactly the fun, nasty horror I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darker stakes help, but the teen romance and length wear me down.

simulated_ratings.title: Weeping for a Bandit (1964)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-school outlaw melodrama that plays slow and dry for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Where Were You When the Lights Went Out? (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light, dated farce with few real laughs for me.

simulated_ratings.title: 66 Scenes From America (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Artsy, static tableaux feel like a patience test—zero interest from me.

simulated_ratings.title: Dave Chappelle: Deep in the Heart of Texas (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blunt, filthy stand-up that hits my crude-funny sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: South Park: Post Covid: The Return of Covid (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Filthy, wrong, and topical—plenty of laughs even if it meanders.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Kid-friendly fantasy hijinks with some fun bits, but it’s a slog at times.

simulated_ratings.title: Heavenly Forest (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender romance and gentle drama—well-meaning but dull to me.
